com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCXmlUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCXmlUtils

  • public class YRCXmlUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for manipulating and using XML Documents, Nodes.

      • write2File

        public static void write2File(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                              java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the XML document to the file. If the file exists, it overrides, else it creates a new one. UTF-8 is used as the file encoding. If the filename parameter is void, this method has no effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write2File

        public static void write2File(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                              java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the XML node to the file. If the file exists, it overrides, else it creates a new one. File encoding may be explicitely specified (if void, defaults to UTF-8). If filename is void, this method no effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public static boolean getBooleanAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element ele,
                                          java.lang.String attrName)
        Get the attribute value as boolean. Returns false if attribute value is void or if the attribute does not exist. Supported true values are "y", "yes", and "true" irrespective of case.

      • getDateTimeAttribute

        public static java.sql.Timestamp getDateTimeAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element ele,
                                                      java.lang.String attrName,
                                                      boolean ignoreTime)
        Get the attribute value as date time. Returns an invalid date time (use DATE_INVALID to compare) if attribute value is void or if the attribute does not exist. XML date time format is assumed to be ISO format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss

      • setAttribute

        public static void setAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element ele,
                                java.lang.String attrName,
                                java.lang.String attrVal)
        Sets an attribute value. If element is null or attribute name is void, it does nothing. If attribute value is null, it sets empty string. If attribute not found, it creates one and sets value.

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element fromEle,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Element toEle)
        Copy all the attributes from the Xml element fromEle to the Xml element toEle. All extra atributes already existing in toEle are left as is. If either of the params is null it does nothing.

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element fromEle,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Element toEle,
                                 boolean clearToEle)
        Copy all the attributes from the Xml element fromEle to the Xml element toEle. Depending on the value of clearToEle, existing attributes of toEle are removed before copying to avoid having extra attributes. If either fromEle or toEle is null it does nothing.

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element ele,
                                 java.util.Map attrMap)
        Copy all the attributes from the name-value pair (any class such as HashTable implementing IDictionary) to the Xml element ele. Any extra attributes pre-exisiting in ele are left as is. If either ele or attrMap is null it does nothing.

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element ele,
                                 java.util.Map attrMap,
                                 boolean clearToEle)
        Copy all the attributes from the name-value pair (any class such as HashTable implementing IDictionary) to the Xml element ele. Depending on the value of clearToEle, existing attributes of ele are removed before copying to avoid having extra attributes. If either ele or attrMap is null it does nothing.

                                                org.w3c.dom.Element ele2beImported)
        Imports an element including the subtree from another document under the parent element. Returns the newly created child element. This method returns null if either parent or element to be imported is null.

      • getChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle,
                                                  java.lang.String childName)
        Gets the child element with the given name. If not found returns null. This method returns null if either parent is null or child name is void.

      • getChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle,
                                                  java.lang.String childName,
                                                  boolean createIfNotExists)
        Gets the child element with the given name. If not found: 1) a new element will be created if "createIfNotExists" is true. OR 2) null will be returned if "createIfNotExists" is false. This method returns null if either parent is null or child name is void.

      • getFirstChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getFirstChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle)
        Gets the first child element if it exists. If not found returns null. This method returns null if parent is null.

      • getLastChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getLastChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle)
        Gets the last child element if it exists. If not found returns null. This method returns null if parent is null.

      • importUnderTargetElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element importUnderTargetElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle,
                                                           org.w3c.dom.Element ele2beImported,
                                                           java.lang.String targetAttributeBinding,
                                                           boolean copySourceModelAttributes)
        Method to import in an element another element but with different node name
        Parameters:
        parentEle - - the element from which to copy the attributes
        ele2beImported - - the parent of the element in which the attributes need to be added
        targetAttributeBinding - - the element in which the attributes need to be added
        copySourceModelAttributes - - set this attribute to true if you want to copy all the attributes in the parent element
        Returns:

      • getElementWithEmptyAttributeValues

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getElementWithEmptyAttributeValues(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Removes the attribute values of the element and all its children.
        Note: The attribute is not removed.
        Parameters:
        element -
        Returns:
        The cloned element with empty attribute values.
